intro: Laserpitium stevenii, commonly known as Steven's fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has a low-growing habit with hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Steven's fleabane is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid environments.
